1459.question: How much is performance hurt when using too small amount of layers in encoder?
1459.response: {'Answer': 'Using too few layers in an encoder may lead to a performance decrease, as indicated by the BLEU and TER scores when comparing models with different layer sizes. For instance, in the provided images, one can observe that a model variant with a reduced number of layers (6-6-4) achieves lower BLEU and TER scores compared to a variant with a standard or higher number of layers.'}
1459.answer: comparing to the results from reducing the number of layers in the decoder, the BLEU score was 69.93 which is less than 1% in case of test2016 and in case of test2017 it was less by 0.2 %. In terms of TER it had higher score by 0.7 in case of test2016 and 0.1 in case of test2017.
